title: Ukrainian students return to school in Kharkiv's underground classrooms
subhead: In regions close to Russia, children have to study in underground shelters due to the threat of bombs. However, there are not enough places, as in Kharkiv, where two-thirds of children ages 6 to 17 have continued to attend their classes online, three years after the start of the Russian invasion.
byline: By Thomas d’Istria (Kharkiv, Ukraine, special correspondent)

title: Did Macron really add €1 trillion to France's national debt?
Sabalenka defeats Anisimova to retain US Open crown: 'I'm speechless right now'
Trump escalates crackdown threats with Chicago 'war' warning
subhead: 'Chicago [is] about to find out why it's called the Department of WAR,' Trump posted Saturday on his Truth Social account as he seeks to replicate the same operation ordered in Washington, where he deployed National Guard troops.

title: Indie favorite Jarmusch beats Gaza war film for Venice top prize
subhead: 'Father Mother Sister Brother' is the first Jim Jarmusch film to compete at Venice. Jarmusch signaled his opposition to Israel's continued siege and bombardment of Gaza by wearing a badge saying 'Enough' at the Venice awards ceremony.

title: Demna's thread between streetwear and haute couture
subhead: 'Essence of a Style' (5/6). Appointed to the helm of some of the biggest fashion houses, six designers are set to command the industry's attention this season. We look back at what has defined their distinctive touch so far, before their trial by fire. In this chapter, the former artistic director of Balenciaga, who is now at Gucci.

title: Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
subhead: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.
byline: By Sophie Abriat and Valentin Pérez

Isabelle Adjani, the masterfully ambiguous Queen Margot
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (5/6). After four years of hesitation that gave the director Patrice Chéreau many sleepless nights, the actress finally agreed to act in this bloody adaptation of an Alexandre Dumas novel.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: Paris, the capital of concentrated wealth
subhead: The accumulation of riches in the French capital 'has reached unprecedented proportions,' according to a report on this new social geography shaped by decades of growing wealth inequality by the Fondation Jean-Jaurès.
byline: By Véronique Chocron and Denis Cosnard
